title: How to get a secure internet browsing - Quora

response.answer_text: There’s security and there’s privacy. You can browse securely by: keeping a firewall & antivirus (always updated)using a browser that is also up-to-datevisiting secure sites (those with S in HTTPS)Privacy? Well, there’s nothing like privacy on the internet. You could use many settings to avoid or remove cookies, use dark browsers, get tools to have anonymous browsing, but your ISP will always know what you do somehow. Some links to check: Anonymizer - Wikipedia Can I hide my browsing history from my Internet provider?

Some browsers offer more secure browsing.Chrome offers Incognito Window.Browse in private VPNs are Virtual Private NetworksThe Best VPN Services of 2018 I use both. Not using the internet is the only guarenteed solution. Using a standard user vs an administrative user is slightly safer. As far as infection risks.
